intro: Artabotrys lastoursvillensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star jasmine. It is a flowering plant native to Madagascar, characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Annonaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and pleasant fragrance. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a glossy dark green appearance, adding to its aesthetic appeal.
